Dr. Sam Sigoloff: The fight against vaccine mandates in the military continues

Military whistleblower Dr. Sam Sigoloff said the service's fight against vaccine mandates is still ongoing.

He made this claim in response to Dr. Jane Ruby's question about whether a whole new fight within the military against mandatory flu vaccination has begun, given that the remaining unvaccinated members still stand against compulsory injections.

"I think there's [going to] be a push to get these lipid nanoparticles (LNPs) in different vaccines. I think it's reasonable to believe that, if you think this is a bioweapon – which I truly do believe," Sigoloff said on "The Dr. Jane Ruby Show."

"A way to kind of measure who you're listening to is if they are unwilling to call it a bioweapon – either the vaccine or the virus. If they call neither of them a bioweapon and are unwilling to entertain that idea, then maybe you should listen to someone else."

Ruby then told Sigoloff that one of the best ways to protect the U.S. military is by obtaining vaccine vials and examining them. The injections should be scrutinized to see if they contain LNPs, dangerous adjuvants, hydrogels, high concentrations of mercury and other toxic ingredients. According to the published international health economist, there are military insiders working under the radar who have access to these vials.

Sigoloff agreed, adding that this a perfect opportunity for American service members to assert their rights. He explained: "Just because you enter the military, you do not lose your human rights – and part of your human rights is … being able to determine what goes into your body." Ruby seconded her guest's remarks, pointing out that members of the U.S. military have been following a "shut up and just do it" mentality for far too long. (Related: Military whistleblowers say cancer, miscarriages and heart disease all up 300% following covid injection mandates.)

Majority of religious, medical exemptions in the military were DENIED

Ruby also mentioned during the program that a lot of military members who applied for religious and medical exemptions to the COVID-19 vaccine were denied. She then asked Sigoloff if there are still service members fighting the coercion inside the armed forces.

While Sigoloff does not know of any military members serving as plaintiffs in a lawsuit challenging the mandates, he shared that those who have reached out to him say they do not want to return to military service anymore.

"I want to get the uniform off. I never want to put it back on. So allowing me to come back in with my pay and rank, that's not that attractive," Sigoloff said.

Ruby commented on his guest's remarks, saying that many service members are indeed turned off completely from rendering military service. Thus, she remarked that an entire revamping of the military needs to happen.
